QREM.functions_qrem.generating_artificial_data.helper_functions module

@authors: Filip Maciejewski, Oskar Słowik, Tomek Rybotycki @contact: filip.b.maciejewski@gmail.com

QREM.functions_qrem.generating_artificial_data.helper_functions.add_physical_perturbation_1q(vector: numpy.ndarray, perturbation_range)[source]
QREM.functions_qrem.generating_artificial_data.helper_functions.get_1q_stochastic_matrix(p10: float, p01: float) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Get single-qubit stochastic map from error probabilities.

Parameters

  • p10 – probability of getting outcome “1” if input was |0>

  • p01 – probability of getting outcome “0” if input was |1>

Returns

single-qubit stochastic matrix

QREM.functions_qrem.generating_artificial_data.helper_functions.get_random_stochastic_matrix_1q(p10_range: list, p01_range: list, distribution_name='uniform') → numpy.ndarray[source]

Get random single-qubit stochastic map with error probabilities chosen randomly from provided ranges

Parameters

  • p10_range – [min,max] value of probability of getting outcome “1” if input was |0>

  • p01_range – [min,max] value of probability of getting outcome “0” if input was |1>

  • distribution_name – stochasticity_type of distribution

possible options: - “uniform”

#todo FBM: add Gaussian types

Returns

single-qubit stochastic matrix
